Authors: Hidajat M., Supria, Luwinda F.A., Sanjaya H.
Title: Emotional Speech Classification Application Development Using Android Mobile Applications
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hidajat, M., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Supria, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Luwinda, F.A., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sanjaya, H., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Customer Relationship Management (CRM) has become popular as it is believed to be able to improve company performance. One of the features of CRM are customer satisfaction level analyses. It is a verbal communication means of sending or receiving information. There are several intonations spoken during verbal communication that reflect the emotional state. Therefore, it can be used to get information regarding the level of customer satisfaction. Sound is one type of digital data that can be processed for an emotional state of classification. In this research, the authors decided to develop a mobile application that is integrated with machine learning to record a sound and classify it into a particular emotional state. This application is believed to be able to improve the user experience and simplify the installation to improve communication engagement. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Android (operating system); Information management; Mobile computing; Public relations; Sales; Application development; component; Customer relationship management; formatting; Mobile applications; style; styling; Verbal communications; Customer satisfaction

Title: Evaluation of Deep Super Resolution Methods for Textual Images
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wongso, R., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Luwinda, F.A., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Williem, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Super-resolution (SR) is one of the important pre-processing methods to refine the text images quality. Though there are numerous introduced algorithms to increase the spatial resolution for textual images, analysis on SR methods using deep learning is still insufficient. In this paper, we focus on evaluating the performance of various deep SR methods which have already confirmed to perform well in natural images super-resolution. Three evaluation metrics are used to analyze the performance of each method, such as peak signal-to-noise ratio (PSNR), structure similarity index (SSIM), and optical character recognition accuracy (OCRAcc). Experimental results show that deeper networks perform better than shallow networks for super-resolution problem. In overall, deep recursive convolutional network (DRCN) and deep laplacian pyramid network (LapSRN) alternately achieve the best performance. Then, very deep super-resolution network (VDSR) obtains the 3rd rank following both methods. © 2018 The Authors. Published by Elsevier Ltd.
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Benchmarking; Optical character recognition; Optical resolving power; Signal to noise ratio; Convolutional networks; Evaluation metrics; Peak Signal to Noise Ratio (PSNR); Pre-processing method; Spatial resolution; Structure similarity; Super resolution; Superresolution methods; Deep learning

Authors: Ranteallo Sampetoding J.L., Satriyawibowo B., Williem, Wongso R., Luwinda F.A.
Title: Automatic Field-of-View Expansion using Deep Features and Image Stitching
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ranteallo Sampetoding, J.L., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Satriyawibowo, B., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Williem, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wongso, R., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Luwinda, F.A., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Automatic photo enhancement, such field-of-view expansion, has become a challenging problem in computer graphics community. Due to the hardware limitation, image acquisition might get distracted by small field-of-view. Photo enhancement using internet photo collections has gained good performance in the past few years. However, it depends on the quality of 3D reconstruction. In this paper, we perform an automatic personal photo enhancement using the photo collection without any 3D reconstruction step. 2D global descriptor is used using NetVLAD deep architecture. Then, image stitching is applied for each similar candidate image. Experiment results show that the propose framework has promising results which could lead to further research. © 2018 The Authors. Published by Elsevier Ltd.
Author Keywords: deep learning; field-of-view expansion; image enhancement; image stitching; netVLAD
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Computer graphics; Deep learning; Expansion; Image reconstruction; 3D reconstruction; Deep architectures; Descriptors; Field of views; Image stitching; Internet photo collections; netVLAD; Photo collections; Image enhancement

Authors: Adrianto D., Luwinda F.A., Yesmaya V.
Title: Augmented Reality Implementation in Watch Catalog as e-Marketing Based on Mobile Aplication
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adrianto, D., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Luwinda, F.A., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Yesmaya, V., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: Augmented Reality is one of important methods to provide user with a better interactive user interface. In this research, Augmented Reality in Mobile Application will be applied to provide user with useful information related with Watch Catalogue. This research will be focused on design and implementation an application using Augmented Reality. The process model used in this research is Extreme Programming. Extreme Programming have a several steps which are planning, design, coding, and testing. The result of this research is Augmented Reality application based on Android. This research will be conclude that implementation of Augmented Reality based on Android in Watch Catalogue will help customer to collect the useful information related to the specific object of watch. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Android (operating system); User interfaces; Watches; Augmented reality applications; Design and implementations; E-marketing; EXtreme Programming; Interactive user interfaces; Mobile applications; Process Modeling; Augmented reality

Authors: Wongso R., Luwinda F.A., Trisnajaya B.C., Rusli O., Rudy
Title: News Article Text Classification in Indonesian Language
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wongso, R., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Luwinda, F.A., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Trisnajaya, B.C., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rusli, O., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rudy, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This research intends to find the appropriate algorithm to automatically classify a news article in Indonesian Language. We obtain our dataset which is taken by using a web crawling method from www.cnnindonesia.com. First of all, the document will first undergo some Text Preprocessing method in the form of Lemmatization and Stopwords Removal. The reason we are doing the Text Preprocessing step before anything else is to minimize the noise in the document. Next, we apply Feature Selection onto the document to further separate important words and less important words inside the document. After applying Feature Selection, the document will be classified by the classifier. We are comparing the TF-IDF and SVD algorithm for feature selection, while also comparing the Multinomial Naïve Bayes, Multivariate Bernoulli Naïve Bayes, and Support Vector Machine for the Classifiers. Based on the test results, the combination of TF-IDF and Multinomial Naïve Bayes Classifier gives the highest result compared to the other algorithms, which precision is 0.9841519 and its recall is 0.9840000. The result outperform the previous similar study that classify news article in Indonesian language which obtained 85% of accuracy. © 2017 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: Classification; Feature Selection; Multinomial Naïve Bayes; TF-IDF
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Classification (of information); Feature extraction; Sodium; Web crawler; Bayes Classifier; Indonesian languages; Multinomials; Multivariate Bernoulli; News articles; Text classification; Text preprocessing; TF-IDF; Text processing

Authors: Sumardi M., Jufery, Frenky, Wongso R., Luwinda F.A.
Title: "tripBuddy" Travel Planner with Recommendation based on User's Browsing Behaviour
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sumardi, M., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Tourism has been an irreplaceable part of economy growth of every country. By that factor, the authors were encouraged to build an application to serve detail information of tour destinations to provide easy preparation for travelling. The application, TripBuddy, was developed to learn user's behavior based on empiric data, which used to offer relevant destinations to certain user by using K-Means Clustering. TripBuddy is a web-based application which suggests optimal route with detail information of destinations, schedule, cost and duration to ease user's travel plan and it also gives recommendation based on user's browsing behavior. © 2017 The Authors. Published by Elsevier Ltd.
Author Keywords: k-means clustering; optimal route; tourism planning; web application

Authors: Chong H., Sudarma H., Luwinda F.A., Faahakhododo I., Gaol F.L.
Title: Wirest lang lab: Mobile platform language laboratory based on REST Web Service
Affiliations: Binus University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia

Abstract: Problem statement: Language Lab plays crucial role in learning foreign language. With its capability to create environment of connecting students with students, connecting student with teacher and giving the impactful learning resources, some of institution are dare to invest of expensive system. Hence, some of them keep searching for more efficient way to learning language. In this study, based on the previous research of REST Web Service as open content, proposed a Mobile Platform Based Language Laboratory on Web Service. With this idea, hopefully, a more fun language learning mobile environment can be created in the future. © 2014 H. Chong et al.

Title: Rank matrixoptimization on NMF, LNMF and nsNMF for feature extraction on mammogram classification
Affiliations: Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Luwinda, F.A., Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia; Santika, D.D., Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: NMF is a quite good feature extraction and classification technique when compared with other similar techniques. NMF has so many variations. The NMF versions that will be used in this research are NMF, LNMF and nsNMF. NMF in this study will be used as a feature extraction and as for the classification technique, Neural Network method will be used. One of the variables in NMF that affect the quality of features is the value of r (number of base image). Objects used in this research were taken from the mammogram MIAS database. These objects will then be divided into 2 classes, Benign and Malignant. This research will explore what the r value is and which is the best variation of NMF to be used in this case. The results showed nsNMF with the value r = 20 is the best NMF to use in this case.The accuracy value reached 75%. © 2012 Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: Bilinear space; Face expression recognition; NMF
References: MIAS Database, , http://peipa.essex.ac.uk/info/mias.html; Swiniarski, R., Luu, T., Swiniarska, A., Tanto, H., Datamining and online recognition of mammographic imagesbased on haar wavelets, principal component analysisand rough sets methods (2001) International SPIE SymposiumMedical Imaging, pp. 17-23; Kim, K., Face recognition using principle component analysis (1996) International Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition, pp. 586-591; Sandhu, P.S., Face recognition using eigen face coefficientsand principal component analysis (2009) International Journal of Electrical and Electronics Engineering; Li, S.Z., Hou, X.W., Zhang, H.J., Learning spatially localized, parts-based representation (2001) Int. Authors: Santika D.D., David, Adrianto D., Luwinda F.A.
Title: DT-CWT and neural network for face recognition
Affiliations: Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Santika, D.D., Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia; David, Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia; Adrianto, D., Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia; Luwinda, F.A., Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: Dual Tree Complex Wavelet Transform (DT-CWT) is improvement of Discrete Wavelet Transform DWT), where DWT have some weaknesses that DT-CWT can solved that problem. DT-CWT can be used as extracted feature of image. DT-CWT can reduce the dimension of highly dimensional data such as large image. This paper use DT-CWT as feature extraction to obtain feature. This paper use Neural Network for recognition and using extracted feature as input and discuss about finding the effective number of node in Neural Network. Through this research, it can be concluded that one hidden layer give better accuracy compared to two hidden layers. A few number of nodes give same result of large number of nodes. The number of each hidden layer not influence the accuracy, but with few numbers of nodes has better time process. © 2012 Elsevier B.V.
References: Faundez-Zanuy, M., (2009) Biometric Security Technology, Encyclopedia of Artificial Intelligence, pp. 262-264; Kingsbury, N.G., The dual-tree complex wavelet transform: A new technique for shift invariance and directional filters (1998) IEEE Digital Signal Processing Workshop, DSP, 98 (86). , Bryce Canyon; Raja, K.B., Ramesha, K., Dual transform based feature extraction for face recognition (2011) IJCSI International Journal of Computer Science Issues, 8 (5). , No 2; Sun, Y., Du, M., Robust face recognition for illumination removal using DT-CWT and EMD (2008) 11th IEEE International Conference on Communication Systems 2008, pp. 357-361; Rajesh, R.S., Jaya Priya, K., Dual tree complex wavelet transform based face recognition with single view (2011) Computational Intelligence and Communication Networks (CICN), pp. 601-605; Kingsbury, N.G., Complex wavelets for shift invariance analysis and filtering of signals (2001) Journal of Applied and Computational Harmonic Analysis, 10 (3), pp. 234-253
